intro: Sphalmanthus praecox, commonly known as the early sphalmanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its blooming period occurs in early spring, producing yellow to greenish flowers that attract pollinators. Sphalmanthus praecox is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
